definition: to put the last hand to (a book, a film etc)/to finalize/to kill-green (a step in the processing of tea leaves)
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
green/blue/black/youth/young (of people)

sentences.english: Did you start editing before having completed shooting three films?
sentences.chinese: 您在三部片子殺青前就開始剪接了嗎？

sentences.english: WHAT a wrap party that's going to be.
sentences.chinese: 那將會是一個激動人心的殺青派對。

sentences.english: The cast and crew of Cranford finally wrap.
sentences.chinese: 克蘭福德劇組終於殺青了。

sentences.english: It includes intelligent control of the cooling room to cool the tea leaves and deactivation of enzymes assisted by roller steam heat.
sentences.chinese: 它包括智能化調控涼青房涼青和滾筒汽熱輔助殺青。

sentences.english: Every selling plan mdewoulse by him is impossible of execution.
sentences.chinese: 他所做的一切銷售計畫都是不能殺青的。

sentences.english: For that dream to come true a second time would be quite amazing.
sentences.chinese: 假使這樣的夢能殺青第二次的話會多麼了不起。

sentences.english: Yu says Wolf Totem, which has just wrapped production, is a perfect example.
sentences.chinese: 於冬認爲近期殺青的《狼圖騰》就是一個完美的例子。

sentences.english: The film is complete and ready for release.
sentences.chinese: 電影殺青並進入發行階段。

definition: to begin shooting (a movie, a scene of a movie etc)/to start the bidding (auction)/to start a trading session (stock market)
to start an engine/to boot up (a computer)/to press Ctrl-Alt-Delete/to begin shooting a film or TV show
Anita Yuen (1971-), Hong Kong actress
to take a curtain call/(fig.) to come to an end
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
to celebrate a heroic deed
Zhao Wei or Vicky Zhao (1976-), Chinese film star
feature-length film
costume drama
to make a movie
Andy Lau (1961-), Hong Kong Cantopop singer and actor
anew/from the beginning/(in poetry and song) repetition of a melody or rhythm
main/most important/essential
Rainie Yang (1984-), Taiwanese entertainer
good news/glad tidings
Chen Kaige (1952-), Chinese movie director
